reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Game that Was Not a Game

I actually waited about 10 days for Garlock since seeing it on the Coming Soon Tab in EA.  I saw some fantasy characters, and free to play" and figured it would be worth at least an attempt.  Here's what happened.

Tried to login for a few hours - finally did
Three classes if you can call them that.  Splinter Cell looking guy seems cool
Entered a city with half English half German wording everywhere.
Click the treasure chest in the bottom right to enter a menu.  Hit esc
date:
game crash.  Excusable.. its EA right?

Login again
No access for a few more hours

Get in again.
Have to remake character.. ok?
I find a "dungeon" or rather a "field" with some enemies.
My game lags but my movement/dmg doesn't.
At this point I realize that everything is clientside.

Fire up CE to check what vulnerabilities there are.

Edit XP to level up?  Works
Edit speed to speedhack?  Works
Edit currency to goldhack?  Works

Ok
recommended: now that I know this game is fatally flawed
hoursPlayed:
I might as well fight a little bit.

killed about 10 enemies.  The game says "killed them" and warps me to town at what
point I have lost 1000xp.  Beautiful.

I click the sword/shield in the corner to try PvP.  Granted
voteText:
there is nobody else in the game.

I join blue team and drop into a zone.  I walk up the wall and out of the map.

I thank the free to play gods that I didn't pay a cent for this game
helpfulPercent: say goodbye via chat to nobody and ALT-F4.\n\nI suggest that you spend 10-15 minutes with a good cup of coffee and maybe petting the dog instead of playing Garlock Online."
commentsCount: 78 of 80 people (98%) found this review helpful 25 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Absolutely can't recommend this so called 'game'. The jokster took some assets from the unity shop and sewed them together with a hot needle releasing this turd nugget.

The few minutes I spent in game I found the following issues:

When registering the password length is limited to 15 chars (although you can use special chars too).
Store page claims to have English voiceover but there is no sound at all - probably muted in the options.
Hitting 'o' for apparently 'options' opens the quest book
Hitting 'I' opens, but does not close the inventory. ESC does the trick.
Hitting 'ESC' brings up a popup shortly (like 2 seconds), so you can't access neither the options nor the disconnect button.
Hitting 'M' trying to open the map just brings up a small picture saving 'PvP' and then it tries to load something but game crashes
Even if you chose to play in German, the short help still is in English.
Unbelievable amount of grammar and spelling mistakes
Ingame button of the community link to the forum (or wherever) directs you to www.garlock-online.com which isn't registered anymore.
Oh, and don't forget those WAY overpriced DLCs!

After the 3rd crash I didn't bother to restart the game and will wait for some patches.

Strange thing is that the game mostly seems to consist of store bough unity assets and still the jokster claims copyright on the game, not mentioning those assets made by other people.
https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/5806
https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/8000

Obviously he missed some legal lessons too trying to become a businessman as the initial EULA was a joke and after advising him to have it checked by an expert he changed it to the present EULA (IMO still a joke but IANAL).
Of course, after pointing out a few more mismatches my posts were deleted and he banned me even I could prove my points.
http://imgur.com/a/mUU0N

So this dev seems like he wants to silence negative critics.

Absolutely terrible as of current Early Access state.

*  English translation is inaccurate.  Full audio?  Not really - didn't hear a single voiceover entire time playing.
*  Starting out is ambiguous.  Finally found where I could go into a level 1 starting area.  Killed 3 mobs, then was instantly killed by a rolling fatty.
*  Sound defaults to off.  Accessing options to turn it back on is clunky.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

unable to create an account or log in. even if i could the game is a unity asset flip. all information written by the dev is in extremely broken english, which is a bad sign considering they teach english in german schools. the trailer shows frame rates in the single digits. cant wait for jim sterling to review it.

EDIT: they patched the game so i can actually get in, so i can review the actual 'gameplay' now. its a broken laughable mess. feels like im in the twilight zone while playing, and not in a good way. poorly mashed together stolen assets that have you playing COD style shooter characters in a cartoon fantasy/anime setting. i would hope this game gets taken down for its stolen assets, most recognizable being the nuka cola machines taken from the fallout series. play it for a laugh, but please give it a negative review.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty trash game featuring ye olde fantasy assests and modern military player models mashed together.
Pros:
Some nice looking assests are used
Potentially some original work in there

Cons:
Game crashes
Horrible interface
Only 3 servers
Basically impossible to control

It seems to be lacking some pretty basic options and is nigh on impossible to control because of the broken interface. (ie UI blurs out, difficult to click on options).
If you want to try this one for a joke it'll ask you to make a seperate account, apparently a steam login isnt enough. I highly suggest avoiding it.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

As many of previous reviewers have stated, this game is at it's current state unplayable.

The controls act like a dual joypad game, however not as crisp.
The character stops when the attack button is pressed
The movement ‚Äúlags‚Äù a little behind


The UI needs much improvement:

UI becomes fuzzy when a building is under neath it
NPC dialogues are ‚Äúin-world‚Äù displays that are hard to navigate
Option menu (Pressing escape) does not stay on the screen so one has to Alt+f4 out of the game.
Option menu however can be accessed via the button for it, however you cannot close it without restarting the game.
Character still moves when in menus.
Weird submenu menu when changing areas or going to the in-game store

Translation is understandable, but it looks like the developer has ran it through Google Translate, and as for the combat I cannot comment as all the mobs that I encountered did not attack, nor could I attack them.

If you want to play this game, then play it with the mindset that you wish to improve and help the developer, if you want to play this game just to play a game, stay far away from this for the time being.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What more can be said about this timeless classic that hasn't already?

Garlock Online is the special sort of artistic adventure into a fantasy world where google translate doesn't exsist and hiring someone with a basic grasp on the english language is forbidden. This game will tug at your heart strings when it presents fascinating quests such as 'Get cake from dealer' and follows it up with 'Find flowers' but the high point of it really is when you finally discover an empty dungeon that reminds you of your fathers disappointment in everything you have ever done.
